business.headline: Sensex plunges 700 points: Why the stock market fell 1% today? The S&P BSE Sensex fell nearly 700 points to 82,509.59, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by nearly 200 points to 25,162.25 as of 12:21 pm.

ITR-2 and ITR-3 excel utilities released: Who can file and what's new?ITR-2 is meant for individuals or Hindu Undivided Families (HUFs) who are not eligible to file ITR-1 (Sahaj). This form is meant for taxpayers who do not have any income from business or profession and do not earn any income like interest, salary, bonus, commission, etc.

Bitcoin breaks $117,000 mark, reaches all-time highAt the time of writing at 11.00 am, the world's largest cryptocurrency is trading at $117,863.18, climbing by 6.13% over the last 24 hours. Crypto experts believe if the supportive policies continue, digital coins could see even more new money coming in.

Tesla drives into India: Mumbai to get first experience centre on July 15The space will allow visitors to explore Tesla's electric cars and related technologies, though test drives and deliveries may not be offered at this stage.

TCS falls 2% on Q1 results miss. Should you buy as IT stocks struggle?TCS share price: The IT giant has lost 2.74% over the past five days and declined 4.37% in the past month. Over a six-month period, the stock is down 22.63%.

Explained: Why HUL shares rose 4% todayHUL shares were up 3.8%, trading at Rs 2,500 as of 9;25 am, compared to Thursday's closing price of Rs 2,409.05. The stock ended Thursday's session nearly 1% lower but has gained 3.58% in the past five days.
Sensex opens 280 points lower, Nifty below 25,300; HUL up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 250.37 points to 82,939.91, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 64.95 points to 25,290.30 as of 9:32 am.

Stock market opening: Weak TCS Q1 results to hamper Sensex, Nifty?The Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,295 as of 8:30 am, suggesting that the Nifty 50 could open below Thursday's closing mark of 25,355.25.
Who is Priya Nair, first woman CEO of Hindustan UnileverPriya Nair will take over from Rohit Jawa, who will step down on July 31, 2025. Nair's appointment will come into effect from August 1, 2025.

IMF praises UPI, says it makes India global leader in fast paymentUnified Payments Interface is an instant and real-time payment system developed by NPCI to facilitate inter-bank transactions through mobile phones.
Sensex closes 346 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Airtel down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 345.80 points to end at 83,190.28, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 120.85 points to close at 25,355.25.

Dubai dreams under scanner as ED questions homebuyers: ReportMany of the individuals who bought property in Dubai are now under scrutiny as they failed to provide proper bank transaction records showing how the payments were made.

8th Pay Commission may hike salaries by 30–34%: ReportThe 8th Pay Commission could benefit around 11 million people, including about 4.4 million central government employees and nearly 6.8 million pensioners. Once approved, the changes will raise their basic pay, allowances, and retirement benefits.

Will ITR filing deadline be extended again? Here's why it mightIn May, the CBDT announced extending the ITR filing deadline, citing big changes in the forms and system readiness. It said that the updated ITRs will make compliance simpler and reporting more transparent for taxpayers.

Zepto, Blinkit, Instamart face a new rival in Delhi's 10-min delivery warThe move brings the e-commerce giant into direct competition with local players such as Blinkit (owned by Eternal), Swiggy Instamart and Zepto, who already dominate the quick delivery space.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe?The bidding window for the IPO will remain open until Monday, July 14. Investors can place bids within the price band of Rs 387 to Rs 407 per share.

When nursery fees need an EMI: CoinSwitch co-founder flags new middle-class crisisOnce believed to be the key to a better life, schooling today has ironically become the heaviest expense for India's middle-class families, who are struggling to keep up, says Ashish Singhal, co-founder of CoinSwitch.

Nvidia now worth nearly as much as India's economy. Details hereAccording to the International Monetary Fund (IMF), India's gross domestic product is currently estimated at $4.2 trillion and is expected to touch $4.27 trillion by the end of 2025.

3 key reasons behind Bitcoin's record high todayAt the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at $111,019.74, rising by 2.27% over the past day. The last record was set on May 22 when it briefly touched $111,970. Since then, Bitcoin has had a bumpy ride, but it seems to be back with a bang.

TCS to announce Q1 results today: Here's what to expect from the IT giantTCS Q1 results: Apart from growth numbers, the market will also watch for any announcements on interim dividends, updates on client budgets in sectors like banking, retail, and manufacturing, and comments on the pace of new deal wins.
Sensex opens 85 points higher, Nifty above 25,400; Tata Steel up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 43.60 points to 83,492.48, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 15.90 points to 25,460.20 as of 9:28 am.

Bitcoin rockets to a record high, just shy of $112,000. Here's whyAs Bitcoin's market cap has crossed into the trillions, more institutional investors are entering the space. Large firms that once stayed away are now taking positions in digital assets, helping push prices higher.

Travel Food Services allotment: Step-by-step to check allotment statusInvestors can check their allotment status either through the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).

Nvidia makes history, becomes first company to hit $4 trillion in market valueNvidia's market cap now exceeds the combined value of the Canadian and Mexican stock markets. It is also larger than the total market capitalisation of all publicly listed companies in the UK, according to LSEG data.

Emirates signs deal to accept crypto payments for flight bookings: ReportIn recent years, the UAE has grown into a popular place for crypto companies. Many crypto firms have opened offices there or are planning to expand. Today, people in the UAE can already use cryptocurrencies to pay for things like real estate, school fees and even transport services.
Sensex closes 176 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HCLTech down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 176.43 points to 83,536.08, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 46.40 points to 25,476.10 as of 3:47 pm.

Reliance Jio IPO hits pause button, 2025 listing unlikely: ReportReliance Industries shares fell sharply after the news and were down 1.8% in afternoon trade, dragging the broader market into negative territory.

Sebi's ban on Jane Street: Could it rattle Dalal Street?While the ban is focused on a single player, many believe it may have wider effects on liquidity, trading volumes, investor confidence, and even foreign investor behaviour.

71% Indians fear AI scams during Prime Day: ReportPrime Day scams India, AI shopping scams 2025, McAfee Prime Day scam report, Fake Amazon websites India, online shopping scam awareness, AI scam protection tips, Prime Day fake deals warning, Indians fear online scams, cyber fraud Prime Day India, deepfake scams online shopping

Travel Food Services IPO to close soon: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPThe bidding for the IPO began on July 7 and is set to close soon. Travel Food Services has set the price band for the issue between Rs 1,045 and Rs 1,100 per share.

ITR filing: Who qualifies for zero income tax?In her 2025 Budget speech, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman shared big news. Under the new regime, if you earn up to Rs 12 lakh, you will not have to pay any income tax. Salaried taxpayers get an extra benefit too.

Infosys, TCS, Wipro: Will top IT companies gain momentum in Q1FY26?Equirus Securities, in its earnings preview, signals a subdued performance for the sector, where even the heavyweights are struggling to regain momentum.

Mutual fund inflows rise 24% in June to Rs 23,587 crore: AMFI dataAmong the 11 equity mutual fund categories, all except equity-linked savings schemes (ELSS) recorded positive inflows. Flexi cap funds emerged as the most preferred option for investors, bringing in Rs 5,733 crore in June.

9 countries where Indians can get citizenship for less than Rs 1 croreAcross many countries, it is now fully legal to buy citizenship. With a single payment or donation, Indians can get a fresh passport that offers visa-free access and minimal global taxes.

ICICI Prudential Asset Management files for IPO. Check offer detailsThe IPO will be an offer for sale of up to 1.77 crore shares, representing 10% of the company's equity share capital. The shares will be sold by Prudential Corporation Holdings Limited (PCHL), a wholly-owned subsidiary of UK-based insurer Prudential.
Crizac IPO listing: Shares debut at 14% premium on Dalal StreetCrizac share price: The stock opened at Rs 280 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) showing a 14.29% premium on its Dalal Street debut.

Will Rs 2,000 SIP make you rich? CA breaks it downMany young investors trust SIPs to secure their future but without clear goals, even long-term discipline might not be enough, warns CA and financial planning advisor Abhishek Walia.

Studying abroad? Here's how you can manage your finances smartlyStudying abroad is a huge step, and an amazing opportunity. But a bit of smart financial planning can help you enjoy every moment without money worries.
Sensex opens 130 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HUL up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 158.94 points to 83,553.57, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 41.70 points to 25,480.80 as of 9:30 am.

Wolfspeed shares surge 248% in 5 days. What's powering this Nasdaq stock?Wolfspeed shares opened with a 43% jump on Tuesday over the previous day's close of $1.18 and reached an intraday high of $3.33. The stock ended the day at $2.52, up 9%.

entertainment.headline: Kuberaa on OTT: When and where to watch Dhanush, Nagarjuna's gritty Telugu thrillerSekhar Kammula's 'Kuberaa', starring Dhanush, Nagarjuna Akkineni, and Rashmika Mandanna, is all set to premiere on Prime Video. The film, praised for its gripping tale and strong performances, explores the dark alleys of Mumbai through a story of conspiracy, ambition, and redemption.

Rajinikanth is shrewd, sharp, and warm, says Shruti HaasanShruti Haasan shared her experience of working with Rajinikanth in 'Coolie', calling him a unique blend of sharp intelligence and genuine warmth. The actor also reflected on how the legendary stars of the past remain unmatched.

Pakistani actor Humaira Asghar Ali died in October, body found after 9 monthsPakistani actor Humaira Asghar Ali's body was discovered in Karachi, believed to have died in October 2024. Her body lay undiscovered due to being disconnected from utilities and vacant surroundings.

Son of Sardaar 2 trailer: Ajay Devgn takes fun to Scotland, jibe on Pakistan followsSon of Sardaar 2 trailer: Ajay Devgn and Mrunal Thakur join a fun ensemble cast in Scotland as the trailer for 'Son of Sardaar 2' was released online. The film is the second part in the action-comedy franchise.

Kareena Kapoor turns photographer for husband Saif Ali Khan, calls him hotKareena Kapoor shared a glimpse of her vacation in London. She turned photographer for husband Saif Ali Khan. Take a look at the picture.

Prajakta Koli only Indian on TIME100 creators listPrajakta Koli has become the first Indian creator to be featured in the TIME100 Creators List 2025. She has been recognised as one of the most influential digital voices globally.

Boney Kapoor remembers Sridevi, calls her an Empress. See picFilm producer Boney Kapoor shared an emotional post in memory of his late wife, Sridevi. Sharing a beautiful picture of her in a golden and black lehenga, he called her an empress.

Aap Jaisa Koi review: Madhavan-Fatima's love story is a dull Rocky Aur Rani...Release Date:Fri Jul 11, 2025Aap Jaisa Koi wants to be bold, progressive, and conversation-starting. But somewhere between intent and execution, this R Madhavan and Fatima Sana Shaikh film loses its spark.

Madhavan says married actors fail to create romantic chemistry on-screenActor R Madhavan opened up about the complexities of performing romantic scenes and the need for true emotional connection. He highlighted that no technical trick can replace genuine chemistry between co-actors.

Actor Yuva on uncle Shiva Rajkumar's towering screen presence: He has that auraDuring an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, Kannada actor Yuva Rajkumar, who is gearing up for the release of his upcoming film 'Ekka', candidly spoke about his uncle and superstar Shiva Rajkumar's powerful screen presence.

Shruti Haasan opens up about her decision to avoid marriage, is terrified of itShruti Haasan opened up about her choice to stay unmarried despite believing in love and commitment, citing her fear of marriage as an institution and valuing self-love and personal growth. She also shared her desire for motherhood with a loving partner.

Meet Premalu's Mamitha Baiju, actor busier than Rashmika Mandanna and SreeleelaMamitha Baiju, who rose to popularity with her performance as Reenu in 'Premalu', is probably one of the most busiest actors in South India. Currently, she has seven projects in hand, which includes Thalapathy Vijay's last film, 'Jana Nayagan'.

Two lords, one frame: Bobby Deol's selfie with Rohit Sharma wins heartsBollywood actor Bobby Deol snapped a cheerful selfie with Indian cricket star Rohit Sharma, thrilling fans across social media. He shared the photo on his Instagram handle.
Asha Bhosle's son refutes death rumours, says it is untrueAsha Bhosle's son, Anand, reacted to the legendary singer's death. In an interview, he said that the news is untrue.

Rajkummar Rao says he'll be great father, clicked with Patralekhaa after baby newsRajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa, expecting their first child, attended a special screening of 'Maalik' in Mumbai. The couple shared their excitement about parenthood.

Former Superman Dean Cain feels James Gunn's immigrant superhero remark is too wokeActor Dean Cain has voiced his disapproval of James Gunn's 'Superman' with regard to the immigrant narrative. He slammed the filmmaker and Hollywood for making iconic characters too woke.

Stand firm against violence: Kapil Sharma's Canada cafe vows to continue after attackThe Caps Cafe in Surrey, recently inaugurated and owned by comedian Kapil Sharma, has issued its first response following an attack on the premises. The cafe stated they are troubled by the incident but remain committed to their mission of spreading warmth and joy. They called for standing firm against violence. This incident occurs against a backdrop of tense India-Canada relations and growing concerns among the Indian community in Canada about targeted attacks on their achievements. The new Canadian Prime Minister, Mark Carney, has expressed intentions to designate pro-Khalistani elements as terrorists, though the effectiveness of this stance remains to be seen. The attack on Caps Cafe highlights the ongoing security concerns for Indian businesses and individuals in Canada.

Parag Tyagi shuts down trolls after Shefali's death: Don't care about judgementsActor Parag Tyagi reacted to all the criticism about being active on social media after wife Shefali Jariwala's death. He responded to the trolls in the comment section of his latest post.

Kangana asks why Diljit has his own path amid row over Sardaar Ji 3Kangana Ranaut reacted to Diljit Dosanjh's collaboration with Pakistani actor Hania Aamir in 'Sardaar Ji 3', emphasising nationalism. She stressed the importance of a unified national agenda.

general news.headline: Ajit Doval's dare on Operation Sindoor: Show me one photo of any damage in IndiaNational Security Advisor Ajit Doval hailed Operation Sindoor as a precise, indigenous response to a Pakistan-backed terror attack. Speaking at IIT Madras, he dismissed claims of collateral damage, challenging critics to show proof.

Had fever, was resting: Tennis player's mother to cops after husband's arrestRadhika Yadav, a 25-year-old national-level tennis player, was allegedly shot dead by her father in Gurugram. Her mother, Manju Yadav, refused to give a formal police statement, citing illness at the time of the incident.

PM goes to countries uninvited; can't we question him? Bhagwant Mann doubles downPunjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann slammed PM Modi over uninvited foreign visits and questioned the Centre's stance on foreign policy and the Diljit Dosanjh film row.

Why Bengal BJP's new chief has taken a new tone on Muslims, communistsBJP Rajya Sabha MP Samik Bhattacharya, an old RSS hand, has assumed charge as the party chief of West Bengal ahead of the crucial Assembly election in 2026. Bhattacharya has surprised many by his outreach to Muslims and communists. Is there a lesson from 2019 and the Kaliganj bypoll behind this?

Aap Jaisa Koi review: Madhavan-Fatima's love story is a dull Rocky Aur Rani...Release Date:Fri Jul 11, 2025Aap Jaisa Koi wants to be bold, progressive, and conversation-starting. But somewhere between intent and execution, this R Madhavan and Fatima Sana Shaikh film loses its spark.

A month on, we may finally know what crashed Air India jet this weekAir India crash report: On June 12, the London-bound Air India flight, a Boeing 787 Dreamliner, crashed into the BJ Medical College hostel building in Ahmedabad within seconds of take-off.

RSS chief says leaders should retire at 75, Congress's 'poor Prime Minister' digRSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that leaders should retire at 75, triggering a dig from the Congress, who speculated about the remark's application to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who will turn 75 in September.

White House shows Trump as Superman amid tariff storm, gets trolledThe White House shared an AI-generated image of US President Donald Trump in a Superman avatar, calling the 79-year-old a "symbol of hope" for all Americans.

Gajar ka halwa from India steals the show at Space Station partyThe special treat, developed for space by ISRO and DRDO, was part of a small party held aboard the station, marking one of the most memorable evenings of the Axiom Mission 4 (Ax-4).

Chinese dam a ticking bomb, says Arunachal CM. Why secretive project is a concernChina's upcoming secretive mega-dam on the Yarlung Tsangpo, just 50 km from the Indian border, was termed a "ticking time bomb" by Arunachal Pradesh CM Pema Khandu. With a massive reservoir capacity and zero transparency on data, experts warn of ecological, strategic, and humanitarian risks downstream.

Radhika Yadav's music video emerges, may have been trigger for tennis star's murderPolice said the primary trigger for the murder was a long-standing dispute between Radhika and her father over the tennis academy she was running.

As BRICS debates reducing dollar dependence, why India is walking a fine lineNew Delhi's core demand: build alternatives that are interoperable and don't just replace the US dollar with another hegemon

10 minutes. 9 bidders. And the OG Birkin sold for Rs 85 croreThe most coveted Hermes Birkin Bag, which was made for the late actress Jane Birkin, has been auctioned as the most valuable handbag sold so far.

Pakistani actor Humaira Asghar Ali died in October, body found after 9 monthsPakistani actor Humaira Asghar Ali's body was discovered in Karachi, believed to have died in October 2024. Her body lay undiscovered due to being disconnected from utilities and vacant surroundings.

Woman arrested for duping 'kitty party' friends of over Rs 30 crore in BengaluruA woman in Bengaluru has been arrested for allegedly cheating over 20 women of Rs 30 crore by befriending them at kitty parties. She is said to have collected large sums under the guise of investment and gold deals, which she didn't return.

Tesla drives into India: Mumbai to get first experience centre on July 15The space will allow visitors to explore Tesla's electric cars and related technologies, though test drives and deliveries may not be offered at this stage.

Zomato surprises YouTuber Gaurav Taneja with birthday hamper after missed cake deliveryIn his post on X, YouTuber Gaurav Taneja said that his birthday cake order had been cancelled due to heavy rain but what followed the next day was a sweet surprise from Zomato.

Goa-based founder fires senior hire within a week for humiliating junior employeeA Goa-based founder fired a senior hire within a week after he humiliated a junior employee during a routine assignment review.

Fake wedding parties: Kya hai yeh nautanki?Fake weddings are becoming popular in Delhi-NCR as a fresh way to party without nosy relatives. These events combine ethnic fashion, street food and a relaxed atmosphere for urban Indians.

Heart of the matter: When a hospital queue in Mysuru taught us a lessonThey weren't sick but they were worried. Outside the Jayadeva hospital in Mysuru, people lined up not for treatment, but for clarity. In a world where heart disease can go unnoticed until it's too late, the quiet question persists: Should I be getting checked — even if I feel fine?

Kapil Sharma's Canada cafe says won't give up after firing by Khalistani terroristIn a strong message on Instagram, comedian Kapil Sharma's Kap's Cafe said that the firing attack late Wednesday night has shocked them, but they won't give up, and will stand firm against violence.

UP's Chhangur Baba got Rs 300 crore from Muslim countries for conversionsOut of this, Rs 200 crore has been officially confirmed, while Rs 300 crore was routed through Nepal using illegal hawala channels.
Who is Priya Nair, first woman CEO of Hindustan UnileverPriya Nair will take over from Rohit Jawa, who will step down on July 31, 2025. Nair's appointment will come into effect from August 1, 2025.

sports.headline: 3rd Test, Day 2 Live: India eye early breakthrough, Root looks for 100IND vs ENG, Lord's Test Day 2 Live Score: As the Lord's Test rolls into Day 2, India will aim to capitalise on their disciplined Day 1 bowling effort—led by Nitish Kumar Reddy's double strike—but the danger still looms with Joe Root unbeaten on 99 and captain Ben Stokes at the crease.

Not a surface to come out swinging: Pope on England's slow batting approachENG vs IND: Ollie Pope explained why England decided to opt for a slow batting approach in the opening day of the Lord's Test. He suggested that the surface used and India's bowling lengths resulted in the batters being unable to freely attack, resulting in a slow scoring day.

Dinesh Karthik takes fans on heartfelt tour of MCC Museum at Lord'sFormer Indian cricketer Dinesh Karthik recently gave fans a personal tour of the MCC Museum at Lord's. He highlighted the 1983 World Cup display, including Kapil Dev's jersey and a replica of the trophy, giving a close-up look at one of Indian cricket's most iconic moments.

England took a different approach: Trott credits hosts' classical battingJonathan Trott praised England's smart, disciplined approach as they hit pause on Bazball and adapted to the testing conditions at Lord's. Led by a patient 99 from Joe Root, it was a day marked by maturity and control rather than explosive strokeplay.

Mitchell Starc reflects on journey to 100 Tests: It makes me feel oldMitchell Starc joked that it makes him feel old as he reflected on the remarkable journey to his 100th Test. He is set to become just the second Australian fast bowler, after Glenn McGrath, to reach the milestone.

India should persist with him: Kumble backs Nitish Reddy's all-round skillENG vs IND: Anil Kumble feels that India should give Nitish Kumar Reddy an extended run in Test cricket. He believes that there is a lot of talent in the 22-year-old and is more than capable of delivering with bat and ball in the longest format.

ENG vs IND: Bazball shutdown, but was it really India's day at Lord's?Day 1 of the Lord's Test saw England being forced to mute Bazball and go for the traditional approach. While India forced the hosts to move away from their usual style, did they actually win the day in the end?

Wimbledon mixed champion Verbeek gets crowd to sing Happy Birthday to dadSem Verbeek marked his first Grand Slam title at Wimbledon 2025 with a special gesture, leading Centre Court in singing 'Happy Birthday' to his father moments after winning the mixed doubles final alongside Katerina Siniakova.

Joe Root has inspired everyone, hope he completes his hundred on Day 2: PopeEngland vice-captain Ollie Pope praised Joe Root for his inspirational presence in the dressing room and expressed hope that the star batter would complete a well-deserved century on Day 2 of the third Test against India at Lord's.

Tottenham Hotspur complete Mohammed Kudus signing from West Ham UnitedTottenham Hotspur have bolstered their squad by signing Mohammed Kudus from West Ham for €55 million, making a bold start to their 2025–26 campaign under new manager Thomas Frank and aiming for silverware on all fronts.

Wiaan Mulder reveals Brian Lara's message: Should've gone for the 400Wiaan Mulder declared on 367 in South Africa's dominant win over Zimbabwe, falling short of Brian Lara's iconic 400. But Lara later told Mulder he should've gone for it and backed him to try again.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
